reviews.review_text:
The place is one among the infinite eateries  scattered all over Goa. This restaurant  is close to Leela Homes, a homestay, so the people here are mostly tourists who saunter in for a decent meal. The food is good, freshly prepared, especially the South Indian varieties. They serve lunch and dinner items as well with a varied  menu comprising  Mughlai, Chinese, South Indian  and good breakfast options.
Service- Good
Ambience- Okayish
Prices- Very Affordable.

Our friend  was given a Dosa with filling of potatoes  so cold it must have come straight out of a fridge but the manager seemed not to care and the dish was not replaced or refunded despite the fact that we told him a few times. Only one waiter said sorry and it was because my breakfast was nearly given to another table.My black tea wasn't   very nice.
For vegetarians in goa, a nice place to have breakfast and over day fast foods.. I visited this place randomly.. quality and quantity is good.. definitely a value for money place..
